Column46: Insightful and Well Organized Food Tour with Elena
Column49:
We had a very enjoyable time on this food tour. The communication leading up to the tour was excellent. They reached out beforehand to introduce our guide and even sent a photo so we knew who to look for. That extra care made a big difference.

Elena, our guide, was outstanding. She was knowledgeable and passionate, offering great insights into the local history as well as the food. We learned a lot and felt truly immersed in the experience.

The food was delicious and the stops were thoughtfully selected. While the tour felt a bit pricey compared to other food tours at a similar price point, I still found it well worth it for the quality of the guide and the organization.

Overall, I would recommend this tour, especially if you value clear communication and a guide who brings the city’s culture to life.

Column86:
We had a fantastic experience on this Bucharest food tour, and much of that is thanks to Alex, our guide, who was truly exceptional. From the moment the tour started, Alex set the tone with his warm, friendly energy and genuine enthusiasm for both Romanian cuisine and culture. He was not only incredibly knowledgeable and informative, but also knew exactly how to engage the group, encouraging conversation and making everyone feel at ease. What could have been a simple food tasting turned into a fun, social experience, thanks to his thoughtful approach and storytelling.

Alex did a wonderful job weaving in historical and cultural context with each stop — not just talking about the dishes themselves, but also about how they fit into Romania’s broader culinary traditions and social history. He struck the perfect balance between sharing information and letting the group enjoy the moment. His passion for the city and its food came through clearly and made the whole experience feel authentic and memorable.

As for the food — it was abundant, varied, and absolutely delicious. Each stop offered something different, from traditional Romanian staples to lesser-known local specialties. We never felt rushed, and we definitely didn’t leave hungry! The pacing was just right, with plenty of time to enjoy each bite and chat with the others on the tour.

Overall, this tour was a highlight of our trip to Bucharest. Alex created a relaxed, welcoming atmosphere that brought strangers together over great food and conversation. Highly recommended for anyone looking to experience Romania through its flavors — and if you can, ask for Alex as your guide. You won’t be disappointed.

Column101: A tour to places tourists would hardly find
Column104:
We did the tour with our guide Andreea on a rainy afternoon with not much else to do in Bucharest and absolutely fell in love with the bars and beers she showed us. Three different locations with four little "shots" of Zaganu-Beer , three bottles at the second location and another one at the last bar, mostly "hipsterish" and well known by the locals, and in between she squeezed the history lesson about the revolution (At the Piata Revolutiei, of course).

My girlfriend and I absolutely fell in love with the city, the stories and the craft beer Andreea showed us with such passion and are sure that the 60 Euro per person are well spend money if you have four hours of time, like to walk and drink some excellent beers while getting to know some history and some of the best bars in town. We would also like to thank Andreea for the tips she gave us that evening and the follow-up email she send the next day - That was the best tour we ever had, and you were the best guide on all our tours! Thanks alot for showing us your city - We will definitely come back as soon as possible and also try other tours of "Urban Adventures"!

Denise and Thorben

Column46: This tour made me want to come back to see more!
Column49: At a friend's suggestion, I took the "Beautiful Decay and Alternative" tour, and I'm so glad I did. I was only in Bucharest for a few days on business and had a single day to look around and get to know the city a little. I wasn't sure what to expect, but I had a great time. My guide, Ioana, was fantastic. The tour took in loads of incredible buildings, from houses to museums, that are in various states of decay but also in various stages of repair and renovation. Each one has a story which Ioana conveyed with knowledge and passion, and we even had special permission to enter a number of them. This was followed by a tour of some amazing street art, which I absoutely loved. We even got to go inside the university and see some incredibe murals by student artists. I got to see a vibrant, creative side of Bucharest which I would otherwise never have been aware of. The tour made me want to visit the city again and get to know it better. If I do, I'll definitely take another one of these tours (maybe the coffee tour Ioana said was in the pipeline!).

Column74: Excellent street art tour of Bucharest
Column77: As a big fan of murals and street art, tracking them in every new city I visit has become a hobby of mine. One of the most efficient ways to find them, especially in Bucharest, where many of the murals are rather hidden, is via a tour. Ioana was an excellent guide for this purpose: highly knowledgeable about the local street art scene, architecture and history. I really enjoyed walking around the center of the city and getting a clearer sense of its vibe. Thanks to Urban Adventures and Ioana for letting me see Bucharest through new eyes.

Column92: Bucharest Localities and Street Art Tour, with Tudor
Column95: Tudor gave us an amazing walkabout on a cold and wet Sunday morning in Bucharest. We learnt so much about local areas and hidden gems of cafes and book shops. We didn't know much about street art or understand its symbolism and beauty, but now we do. Amazing. And we heard the stories about the new, old and crumbling architecture that is part of the understated beauty that is Bucharest. Tudor was knowledgeable and enthusiastic and loves his work. We hope to visit again and select another tour with Tudor.

Column41: Amazing afternoon with Mirjana! Started from the Riva (promenade) and made our way through busy streets of Split, squinchy yet easily navigable to the main sights! Admired to the stories of the past - Roman Emperors and did I mention the Sphynx?! Afterwards we swooped to the Green market within the walking distance and got ourselves local snacks, cheese, olives and grapes - worthy the nectar of gods! Highly recommendable for an easy Split immersion experience!

Column2: Hoi An at Sunset: Tasty Street Food Tour
Column7: See what happens in Hoi An after sunset on an evening food and walking tour. By exploring at night, you'll enjoy cooler temperatures and see a different side to Hoi An Ancient Town’s illuminated landmarks. Feast on Vietnamese delicacies—including BBQ pork rolls and white-rose dumplings—you may have otherwise missed, and receive personalized attention from your guide in a small group limited to 12 people.

Column38: A different side to Hoi An
Column40:
Starting with a cute boat ride we arrived at the destination of our bike ride which took us through the villages and farm areas of Hoi An.

Our guide Nam was knowledgeable and informative and made us feel well looked after as we road past water buffalo’s, fish farms and market gardens, arriving at our dinner destination for a beautiful home cooked meal at a local Vietnamese restaurant using herbs and vegetables from the surrounding farms.
Our chef Thanh was entertaining and a master chef! Meal was delicious.

A fabulous afternoon spent enjoying a different side of Hoi An.

Highly recommend!
Read more

Column83: A Pleasant afternoon which will be remembered!
Column85:
Went on this tour with my partner her parents and her brother. Our tour guide Nam was great from the get go my partners parents were a little hesitant about the 13km bike ride but Nam assured us it would be fine...it was for those of you worrying about the distance the bikes are easily pedalled and the terrain is mostly flat!
As for the the scenery pedalling through the rice paddies, shrimp farms and local villages with young kids running out to say hello is charming with Nam reiterating that the Vietnamese people are some of the most friendly people on the planet. His knowledge of the local area, farming techniques was a great insight into the resilience of the people.
The tour ends on a small fishing/river boat if you have experienced and dined on one of the larger boats with the buffets and entertainment this is the pleasant opposite.
Our captain & chef Mr. Rin greeted us with a big smile and welcomed us aboard as we sailed down the river and indulged in pork skewers, grilled shrimp, chicken and finished with a beef Banh Mi (yum) this tour concludes as you sail at sunset into the lantern covered hustle and bustle of Hoi An Ancient Town & is a great way to finish the tour.
Highly recommend Nam and the Urban Adventure Team!
Read more

Column104: My husband and I loved the bike and cruise tour. It was one of the highlights of our trip. Our guide was so lovely and friendly, and very knowledgeable about the area. Her English was fantastic! It was very interesting to see how the locals live and grow their produce once you get outside the town a little. The cruise with BBQ was such a nice way to finish off the tour, coming into Hoi An old town past all the colorful boats and lanterns was beautiful, and the BBQ was delicious! I was a little worried as I haven't ridden a bike in a few years, but it was an easy ride and our guide made managing the busy traffic easy when necessary.

Column38: A glimpse into the past of a once mighty culture
Column40:
We (party of two) took part in the My Son Discovery (starting in Hoi An) Tour.
The early morning timing is important, as we were then ahead of the crowds, which might otherwise have diminished our good experience. Our Local UrbanAdventures Guide Nam Pham managed it really well, that we were mostly alone in the various sections of the site. This certainly added to our experience. His explanations and his background knowledge of the site was helpful for us to grasp at least a bit of the Champa culture.
We also enjoyed that he was relaxed enough to go to a local Mí Gà Restaurant on the way back, as we had missed out breakfast (due to the early start) and were hungry.
Thumbs up!

Read more

Column76: A fantastic 5 hour excursion to My Son. The journey itself is very interesting as you get to see life outside the tourist centre of Hoi An. Our guide, Nampham, brought My Son to life with over two hours viewing and describing the site. We arrived by 8.30am before the tourist hordes arrived and pretty much had the place to ourselves. Sadly you can see where the American bombs and bullets destroyed the ancient sites. Nampham made a lot of effort and helped us understand a lot more about the temples than we had read about in our guide book. Go there!

Column83: Amazing Tour with an Amazing Guide
Column86:
Urban Adventures is a fantastic tour company. And try to get Luong Luong for your guide. She is the best guide we’ve ever had - funny, smart, informed, and takes charge so we had a great experience. She showed us the beautiful temples at the My Son UNESCO site. We leaned just the right amount of information (and it was accurate!) while moving through the site at the perfect pace.

My Son is quite beautiful and being restored at a good pace. Many countries around the world have provided funds and experts to create a beautiful site. And the Vietnamese government provides educational staff to showcase traditional music and dance.

Column20:
What an awesome tour we had on Tuesday 18 June with our very knowledgeable guide - Doris, from Urban Adventures. I highly recommend this tour around the Old City of Dubrovnik and Lovrenjac Fort. It made me feel as though I had been transported back in time. With Doris providing detailed descriptions of the scenes filmed at each of the locations and having a photo showing
the actual scene just made you feel as though you were on set. Doris was patient and answered all questions asked and also provided some interesting bits of information about the actors that she had met during their stay in Dubrovnik. The tour group was small enough so that we all felt that we were receiving individual attention.
Most enjoyable.

Column30:
I took the Game of Thrones tour and my guide was Doris. I have only great things to say about the experience on this tour and Croatia. Doris met us with a smile and we were all excited to see that we had a small group to experience our Game of Thrones tour with. When we began she introduced herself to everyone and went through the group interacting with each person, finding out what their names were. This set a comfortable tone for the tour and all participants were interactive from beginning to end. Doris was so informative about the series and filming that took place in Dubrovnik adding many interesting fact and details however also added a lot of information regarding set changes that made it feel as though you were there during filming. A must do interesting tour for fans of the show but even for those who may not be. Thanks Doris I truly enjoyed it!

Column2: Half-Day Tour in Delhi: Local Food Walking Adventure
Column7: It can be difficult as a first-time visitor to know where to find the best local food spots in Delhi. Discover hidden haunts that you likely wouldn’t discover alone by going on this small-group walking tour. Save time by riding a rickshaw around Kamla Nagar neighborhood, and stop off for delicious tastings along the way. Highlights include trying shawarma, fruit beer, bhaji, sweet samosas, and homemade ice cream.
Column13: This is booked 19 days in advance on average.

Stress-free Delhi food tour with all food and drink tastings included

More than food—see Hanuman Temple and top sights along the way

Column65: A Delicious, Fun & Personalised Tour with Reetika!
Column68: Reetika was an excellent tour guide, full of stories and the tour felt care-free with her. We stopped off at 5 different savoury spots and 2 different sweet spots, all around the area in Delhi where the local university students go. She tailored the food to our spice needs, so the food provided felt personalised. The walking tour took us to the local temple and around the streets of the local shops and market stalls. Reetika was particularly considerate about pushing us to try the Delhi Metro, which was surprisingly easy and stress-free for a couple of Londoners! What a great tour and thank you again Reetika for your kindness and a great tour!

Column2: San Jose on Foot: Market Food Delights and City Sights Tour
Column7: Visit a pair of traditional markets in San Jose on a guided walking tour that explores local flavors, culture, and history. From a fresh cup of Costa Rican coffee to tropical fruits, you’ll sample the best of what’s in season here. It’s a great chance to see a side of the city that many visitors overlook, and walking around with a local guide means an insider perspective on life in San Jose.

Column48:
Our guide picked us up on time and as agreed at the National Theater.
The guide spoke fluent English and gave us a lively introduction to the history of San Jose and Costa Rica.

We were in remote places and parks, and he had a lot to tell us about them.
In the middle of the tour there was a short stop with a coffee of your choice and a traditional tortilla.

The subsequent detour to the central market was also very informative and absolutely fantastic in terms of food.
We tried various fruits and a kind of sorbet with cinnamon.

It was great that we had booked our tour as a public tour.
As "JOHN" didn't show up, we were alone with our guide.

All in all, a worthwhile tour.
Read more

Column2: San Jose By Night: Sights & Culture Tour with Local Dinner
Column7: Discover San Jose's culinary delights and see cultural institutions including Morazán Park on this evening tour. Stroll past the Metallic Building, then on to Spain Park for a fantastic view of the Yellow House (now the Ministry of Foreign Affairs). Continue by car to charming Barrio Escalante (one of the oldest?residential?areas?in San Jose) where you finish the night with traditional meal and a couple of glasses of sangria or beer.

Column56: Perfect activity for travelers new to San Jose/Costa Rica
Column59:
Very Highly recommended
We had an evening to kill in San Jose between our flight landing in the afternoon and heading off to central valley the following morning. We are a family of 4 that includes 17 and 21 year old children.
Daniel was our guide and the experience was a perfect way to fill that evening. He was very interesting to listen to and taught us a lot of about CR culture and history. The evening was capped by the best food we had in CR.
Note - you only eat at the very end of the tour so don't start out hungry!

Column101: Had a great time on this tour!
Column104:
Emil is a fantastic guide!

The tour almost got cancelled due to weather and others ended up cancelling or rescheduling, but I joined and Emil ended up giving me a private tour.

We toured mostly east from the meet point to Barrio Escalante, which is well worth the walk! A beautiful area with good restaurants serving excellent food.

My big thanks goes to Emil. Wise beyond his years, he is extremely knowledgeable and is perfectly fluent in English. I learnt a lot of Costa Rican history from him. He is a clear communicator, friendly and positive.

Column2: Private Nightlife Tour in Denver: Culture, History, and Cocktails
Column7:
Discover the rich culture and history of Denver, as well as its thriving cocktail scene, on this walking tour. Led by a local guide, you will visit popular hangouts and sample some of Denver's most beloved drinks. Take a stroll through the trendy Larimer Square and the Lower Downtown neighborhood, walk down historic streets, and step inside bars and modern-day speakeasies to learn about the history and inspiration behind cocktails. This tour is a perfect blend of culture, history, and cocktails! 

Highlights
- See the city through the eyes of a local as you explore Denver with a resident guide, eager to show you their favorite drinking establishments.
- Bottoms up! Deep dive into Denver’s vibrant cocktail scene, sampling the city’s best drinks, from local twists to international classics.
- Learn about Denver’s cocktails and how they fit into the history of the city
- This tour is carbon neutral, operated by a B Corp certified company committed to using travel as a force for good.

Column2: Red Rocks Amphitheatre Historical Walking Tour
Column7:
Explore the legendary Red Rocks Amphitheatre on this guided walking tour limited to just 12 guests. Walk scenic trails, learn about 150-million-year-old fossils, and hear stories of the Ute people who once held ceremonies here. Visit the famous amphitheatre where icons like The Beatles and U2 performed, and enjoy a rich mix of nature, music, and history in one unforgettable experience.

- Duration: 2-hour guided walking tour through Red Rocks Park
- Explore the amphitheatre known for its unique acoustics and history
- Local guide provides insights into geology, history, and wildlife
- Enjoy a small group tour limited to just 12 guests for a personal touch

Column65: Fantastic Chicago Food Tour with Rich
Column68:
I had such a great time on this food tour today! Rich was a fantastic guide—friendly, knowledgeable, and so welcoming from the start. The group was small and intimate, which made it easy to chat and enjoy the experience together.

We stopped at some amazing local spots, including Lou Malnati’s for deep-dish pizza, a classic steak sandwich place, and a fun hot dog stop. I’m vegetarian, and Rich made sure I was catered to at every stop, which I really appreciated!

The tour was a great mix of delicious food, Chicago history, and fun conversation. I’d definitely recommend it to anyone wanting a more personal and authentic food tour experience in the city!

Column2: Boston's North End: A Small Group Foodie Adventure
Column7: Visit off-the-beaten-path local bakeries and pizza joints that you might never discover on your own by joining a small-group food tour of Boston’s North End. With a guide to lead the way, you don’t have to waste time looking up where to go next or navigating the North End’s narrow streets. Instead, focus on enjoying the neighborhood’s robust sights and flavors.
Column13: This is booked 31 days in advance on average.
Column14:
Highlights
Snack your way through Boston’s Italian district on a guided food tour
Get to know other foodies on a small-group tour
Visit historic sites and learn about the development of Boston’s Little Italy
A guide provides personalized recommendations for where to eat after the tour
This tour is carbon neutral, operated by the world’s largest travel B Corp accredited company.

Column56: New York Foodie meets North End
Column59: We had Alison as our guide for our group (4 total). I went with my 7 year old son and we had SUCH a great time! It was one of the personal highlights of my trip to Boston. As a foodie, and a New Yorker, I am spoiled with great food. The experience we had was awesome. We went to non-touristy places, and even one tucked away down an alley -the kind of place where you'd have to be in the know to go. Though my son is also a foodie, he gets restless at times, but Alison (having 3 kids of her own) handled him with such grace and patience, and kept him engaged with I-spy when he had his "kid moments", as well as addressed his plethora of questions along the way. I was so happy with the quality of the food, the information related to the history of the significant points of interest along our route, the pace, and the pleasure of having Alison as our guide. I would wholeheartedly recommend this tour to anyone who has high food expectations and are looking to make a connection between what they eat, and the stories behind them.

Column2: Boston: A Food & History Journey from North End to Freedom Trail
Column7: First-time visitors and Boston regulars alike should not miss the chance to get to know the food, history, and culture of Boston on this two-in-one tour. By traveling through the historic Italian district and the Freedom Trail on a small-group tour you don’t have to worry about navigation or deciding where to go next. Instead, rest assured that your guide won’t miss any of the tastiest and most interesting stops.
Column14:
Highlights
Explore Boston’s rich history and food on a combo tour that melds both
A small-group tour ensures individual attention from the guide
Indulge in Italian food along the route
Visit off-the-beaten-path joints that most visitors never discover
Discover the first bookstore in Boston and see the site of the first public school in America
Visit the first public park and botanic garden in Boston
Join a tour that is carbon neutral, operated by the world’s largest travel B Corp accredited company

Column28: A great way to settle into Boston!
Column31:
We had such a great time spending the day with Bob (& Caitlyn) walking, talking and eating our way around Boston’s North end, Freedom Trail and Beacon Hill.

As our first introduction to the city, Bob gave us a wonderful overview of the sights and history while we enjoyed some delicious food and good company. He is incredibly knowledgeable and personable, and dedicated to ensuring your time in Boston (well beyond the tour) is fully enjoyed.

The small size of the group was appreciated as we could enjoy hidden gems and more intimate settings. We were so glad we were not part of the giant tour groups we passed, blasting their overly scripted info and waiting for all to keep up, while we briskly moved through the city enjoying one another's company.

Bob not only provided great information on the tour, but followed up sharing all we did and more, for reference.

We will definitely look for more Intrepid Tours as we travel.

**Wear comfy shoes. Bring water. This is a rigorous, albeit enjoyable, walk!

Column2: Boston Seafood Tour: Go Behind the Scenes at the Fish Pier
Column7: Go behind the scenes of Boston’s iconic seafood scene with a local guide on a tour that helps you explore the city like a local. Explore the oldest working fish pier in the US, visit family-run seafood shacks, and enjoy tastings of lobster rolls and clam chowder. Plus, learn about sustainable practices and Boston Harbor’s remarkable transformation.

Column20: Don't think twice before registering for this awesome Boston Seafood Tour! The tour takes you to the oldest family-run seafood restaurants; the history of seaport is woven around these enterprising individuals and families who have stood their ground firmly against the capitalist food chains. Nabil made the tour one of the memorable ones with his charm, humour, in-depth knowledge about the history of the Boston seaport and most importantly, his personal contacts with the seaport community! I am a seafoodie and the clam chowder, bluefin tuna sushi, and lobster roll served to us was one of the best quality seafoods I've ever had. At the end of the 2.5 hours trip you feel amazed to see a different 'America' and non-touristy Boston that is not often talked about.

Walking through the seaport area with Tim explaining the history of the fishing industry, the wharf, & south Boston was a great way to explore the area. It was a warm day so Tim prioritizing finding us a (mostly) shady route was much appreciated.

We would recommend this tour to anyone and will definitely seek out other Intrepid tours in the future.

Following your guide to local spots you wouldn't find on your own, you'll taste everything from dumplings to Italian delicacies. Column65: Interesting history and tasty food samples
Column68: Our guide Jessie was wonderful. A very good storyteller, full of interesting bits of history. Nice balance of serious facts and humor and fun trivia. The 4 foods we sampled were all tasty, but on the smaller side. Think of it more as a tasting tour and not a meal replacement. Don't worry, you're not left hungry! But these are smaller "try it" samples. Love that they prioritize immigrant businesses, both old and newer. We had some excellent fried pork dumplings, two kinds of italian cheese, a part of a potato knish, and a chocolate rugelach. And you end at Essex Market, so lots of options to buy interesting things if you're wanting to sample even more foods on your own.

Column2: New York Private Broadway Experience with a Drink
Column7:
Discover New York's Broadway, hitting all the world-famous theatres in The Big Apple. Check out a popular watering hole for Broadway performers then grab a drink of your own at a piano bar. 

Highlights:
• Learn all about how Broadway productions come to be and explore Time Square's iconic theatres.
• Walk through Hell's Kitchen and hear about it's fascinating immigration history.
• Visit Broadway Rehearsal Studio
• End it all with a drink at a legendary piano bar where many Broadway stars found their start.

Column2: New Orleans Jazz Tour: History and Live Jazz
Column7: Experience the soulful music scene of New Orleans with a local guide who knows where the best live jazz is happening each night. Venture beyond the typical tourist path to explore vibrant music spots like Frenchmen Street, Bourbon Street, or Preservation Hall. Enjoy live shows and spontaneous street performances as your guide curates the evening’s route to ensure you catch the city’s most exciting acts.
Column13: This is booked 33 days in advance on average.
Column14:
Highlights
Venture outside the French Quarter to New Orleans’ hottest music venues
Jazz-savvy guide means you can save time spent searching event listings
Learn about the history of jazz at landmarks like Louis Armstrong Park
Discover hidden gems and experience authentic local music

Column83: 300 years of history in 2.5 entertaining hours
Column85:
From Congo Square where it all began to Mahogany Hall, where the finest contemporary practitioners play, this tour took us through the history of New Orleans jazz—or at least the 20th century history. That was perfect for us, since we wanted to hear about the “big picture” of New Orleans jazz.

Our guide, Adam, was knowledgeable and personable, and he had a real passion for his subject. Hopefully you get him to show you around.

Column2: New Orleans Food Tour: Beignets, Gumbo & French Quarter
Column7: New Orleans has a diverse food scene with delicious dishes. Choosing where to eat can be a tricky task for a first-time visitor, so avoid the potential dilemmas, and go on a French Quarter food tour instead. Travel in a small group to interesting eateries, sampling classics like beignets and gumbo, and learning about the city’s culinary history along the way.
Column13: This is booked 26 days in advance on average.
Column14:
Highlights
Discover the best local institutions to visit in New Orleans’ French Quarter
Hear stories about New Orleans’ food history from your guide
Hassle-free tour with food tastings included

Column17: Highly recommend this tour—and especially Kaffey—for anyone visiting New Orleans!
Column20:
We had an absolutely fantastic food tour of the French Quarter with Kaffey! From the moment we met, her warm personality and deep knowledge of New Orleans history made the experience so much more than just tasting incredible food. She wove fascinating stories about the city’s culture and traditions into every stop, helping us appreciate the roots of each dish we tried.

The food itself was outstanding—everything from iconic classics to hidden local gems we never would have found on our own. Kaffey paced the tour perfectly, making sure we had time to enjoy each bite while still keeping the energy and excitement going.

Highly recommend this tour—and especially Kaffey—for anyone visiting New Orleans!

Column2: Private Space Needle and Seattle Center Tour
Column7:
Explore the vibrant Seattle Center with a local guide and enjoy stunning views from the Space Needle. This 2-hour private tour offers an in-depth look at Seattle’s rich art and cultural scene. Marvel at the iconic Space Needle, rising 520 feet above the city, and gain insight into Seattle's history and landmarks. Visit key sites like the Museum of Pop Culture and the International Fountain, and learn about Seattle's music history. Perfect for small groups, this tour includes admission to the Space Needle and a knowledgeable guide to enhance your experience.

- 2-hour private tour of Seattle Center and Space Needle
- Includes entrance fee to the Space Needle with 360-degree views
- Local guide shares stories of Seattle's art and history
- Private tour offers a deeper, more immersive experience.

Column77: The Gandhi's Delhi tour was very informative and well worth doing if you have some time in Delhi. Ask for Sunny as your guide on this tour or any of the many tours provided by Urban Adventurers. Sunny demonstrated a comprehensive knowledge of Gandhi’s life but also modern India which was fascinating, and his excellent English was literally the best that I heard from any guide during my time in India. He anticipated my preferences expertly and provided a tour which aligned perfectly my interests Nothing was too much trouble. I could not recommend Sunny more highly as a guide for his knowledge, professionalism and generosity of spirit.

Column95: I had a wonderful tour with Dikshika Chauhan to old Delhi on 2/23/2020 with my friend Lachlan. I must tell you that for one, she is a amazing tour guide who is very knowledgeable about the sights and sounds in Old Delhi. There was times I had trouble walking stairs and she held my hand to make sure I didn’t fall, or get injured especially in the busy markets of Meena Bazar, Chadni Chowk , and Humayun tomb. I really enjoyed going to the spice market and bought some incredible Masal chai at A. Kumar. I was taken by how well she was able to handle the crowds, streets and frantic traffic, I felt safe and well cared for during the whole tour. I would recommend Urban Adventures tours to anyone who wants to learn about the old Delhi culture and history, and have a fun time with a lovely, kind, tour guide, Dikshika Chauhan.
